bestBHT.bht: Mary, a Jewish Christian in Rome, is commended for her labor and toil among the believers. She is praised for her hard work and dedication, having bestowed much labor on Paul and the community. Even though there is limited information about her, her name is mentioned in gratitude, highlighting the impact she had on those around her. Mary's example serves as a reminder to all believers to diligently serve and labor for the cause of Christ.

Henry Alford: 6.] None of the names occurring from ver. 5–15 are mentioned elsewhere (except possibly Rufus: see below).
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: labour on us—labor, no doubt, of a womanly kind.
Albert Barnes: Who bestowed much labour on us - Who labored much for us.
Nothing more is known of her but this honorable mention of her name.
It is probable that these persons were formerly residents in Greece, and that the apostle had there become acquainted with them, but that they had now removed to Rome.
Marvin Vincent: Mary (Mariam Mariam). Westcott and Hort read Marian. A Jewish name, the same as Miriam, meaning obstinacy, rebelliousness.
John Calvin: He again testifies his gratitude, in recording the kindness of Mary to him.
Nor is there any doubt but that he commemorates these praises, in order to recommend those whom he praised to the Romans.
It is said of Mary, that she 'labored much,' unto us, or among us.
Philip Schaff: Salute Mary. This is the sixth person of this name mentioned in the New Testament."
Characterized as one who bestowed much labor on you."
When preaching and teaching are meant, ‘in the word’ is usually added.
Archibald T. Robertson: Mary (Μαριαν). Some MSS. have Μαριαμ, the Hebrew form. The name indicates a Jewish Christian in Rome. Paul praises her toil. See Luke 5:5.
John Gill: Greet Mary, who bestowed much labour on us.
It seems most likely that the persons on whom this good woman bestowed so much labour, and to whom she was so very serviceable, were the saints at Rome.
Her name Mary is the same with Miriam in Hebrew; whether she was of Jewish extract is not certain, and who she was is not known.

bhtAttempts.bht: Mary, a Jewish Christian in Rome, is commended for her labor and toil among the believers. She is praised for her hard work and dedication to the cause. Although not much is known about her, her name is mentioned with honor, highlighting the impact she had on those around her. Paul acknowledges her efforts and expresses gratitude for the kindness she showed him. Mary's diligent service serves as an example for all believers to strive for in their own work within the community.

Mary, a Jewish Christian in Rome, is praised for her labor and toil among the believers. Her name is mentioned in gratitude for the kindness she showed Paul and her diligent service to the community. Not much is known about her, but her impact is evident in the commendation she receives. Mary's dedication and hard work serve as an example for all believers, encouraging them to persevere in their own labor for the sake of the Gospel.

Mary, a Jewish Christian in Rome, is commended for her labor and toil among the believers. She is praised for her hard work and dedication, having bestowed much labor on Paul and the community. Even though there is limited information about her, her name is mentioned in gratitude, highlighting the impact she had on those around her. Mary's example serves as a reminder to all believers to diligently serve and labor for the cause of Christ.

Mary, a Jewish Christian in Rome, is praised for her labor and toil among the believers. She is commended for having bestowed much labor and working diligently for the cause. Though not much is known about her, her name is mentioned with honor, indicating the impact she had on Paul and the community. Her dedication and hard work serve as an example for all believers to strive for in their own service and labor within the Christian community.

Mary, a Jewish Christian in Rome, is honored for her labor and toil among the believers. She is commended for her hard work and diligent service. Although not much is known about her, her name is mentioned with gratitude, emphasizing the impact she had on Paul and the community. Mary's dedication and labor serve as an inspiration for all believers, encouraging them to work diligently and selflessly in their service for Christ and His Church.
